title: Vegetable Crop Rotation on Small Farms with Jordan Scheibel and Hannah Breckbill

tasks.task: Physical tasks related to running a small farm in central Iowa.
subtasks: Deciding on annual production, planting beds for high tunnels and market garden.
Managing crop rotation, considering disease cycles, soil fertility, and market demand.
Hand-tilling and preparing soil for intensive market garden beds using a BCS walk-behind tractor.
Hand-cultivating beds, applying compost, and setting up overhead irrigation systems for high-value crops.
Operating a paper pot transplanter for direct seeding into mulched beds without tilling.
Implementing high tunnel management for fall and spring greens, addressing temperature and weed control.
Recording crop rotations and field plans using spreadsheets for planning and historical reference.
Navigating changing market demands, reducing less profitable crops, and diversifying due to evolving farm systems.
